column4: Hello, I was wondered about mount.ntfs, when rw access to that disk is big it eats all my cpu. Suppose it is nothing to do about that. Can I somehow move my partition from ntfs to eht2, without copying all data to another disk?
No, you would need to backup your data, reformat the disk you want to use as ext3, and then restore your data to it
there's no "inplace" migration from NTFS to ext3
